content.description: Less than 10 Years’ Experience Mean (Standard Deviation)
content.question: Less than 10 Years’ to Retirement Mean (Standard Deviation) Employee Satisfaction 5.5 (3.61) 6.2 (0.94) An industrial-organizational psychologist surveyed employees at a tire factory to gain an understanding of employee satisfaction. The factory manager is interested in differences between employees with less than 10 years’ experience and those with less than 10 years to go before retirement. The survey asked participants to rate their work environment using a scale from 1(poor work environment) to 10 (excellent work environment). Which of the following best describes how the I/O psychologist might interpret the difference in the standard deviations between the two groups?

choices.label: There is very little variation in age for the less experienced group, while the ages of the more experienced group are mostly the same.
The scores of the less experienced group varied more widely from each other than the more experienced group.
The scores of the more experienced group were less alike than those from the less experienced group.
The more experienced group has higher employee satisfaction.

content.answer: The scores of the less experienced group varied more widely from each other than the more experienced group.
